src:
Kil juri i 12. uzastopnu pobedu
Zebre sa Baltika su u sjajnoj formi i favoriti u Manhajmu protiv ove sezone slabog Rajn Nekar Levena u derbiju 12. kolo rukometne Bundeslige

07 Nov 2019

Pre početka sezone Kilu i Rajn Nekar Levenu su, uz šampiona Flenzburga, davane najveće šanse za titulu u rukometnoj Bundesligi. Zebre sa Baltika su to opravdale, imaju samo jedan poraz, dok su Lavovi razočaranje prvog dela šampionata u Nemačkoj.
Oba tima u različitom raspoloženju i formi dočekuje derbi meč 12. kola u četvrtak (19.00) u Manhajmu. Posle tri godine u dresu bogatog Pari Sen Žermena u Rajn Nekar Leven se vratila najveća zvezda nemačkog rukometa u protekloj decenije Uve Genshajmer. Jedno od najboljih krila današnjice igra odlično, efikasno, sa 85 golova je prvi strelac tima, ali nema pomoć saigrača.
Švedski trener Kristijan Anderson koji je ove sezone zamenio trofejnog Danca Nikolaja Jakobsena još nije našao pravu formulu. Ekipa igra loše i već ima tri poraza i pet bodova manje od lidera Hanovera. U napadu i dalje sve konce vuče vremešni Švajcarac Andi Šmid.„Kil je izvanredan, a mi nismo. Moramo da kažemo da nije pet do 12 već je 12 sati. Možemo da pobedimo Kil, ali ako budemo igrali svi najvišem nivou“, rekao je za nemačke medije srednji bek Lavova.


SVE KVOTE ZA OSVAJAČE BUNDESLIGE





Domaćin će imati veliku podršku rasprodate dvorane u Manhajmu, ali gosti imaju ulogu favorita. Lavovi nisu pobedili u Bundesligi već tri kola. Posle dva vezana remija prošle nedelje su poraženi u Berlinu od Fuhsea.
S druge strane, Kil je fantastičan. Predvođen debitantom na klupi Filipom Jihom, Zebre gaze. Imaju 11 uzastopnih pobeda u Bundesligi i Ligi šampiona. Jedini neuspeh je doživljen na startu sezone u Magdeburgu. U evro eliti pobeđeni su Vesprem i Vardar u gostima i tim sa Baltika je potvrdio da se vraća na staze stare slave kada je bio dominantan u Nemačkoj i tri puta bio šampion Evrope.
U napadu briljiraju Norvežanin Harald Reinkind i Austrijanac Nikola Bilik, na golu je sjajan Danac Niklas Landin Jakobsen, dok je lider u odbrani kapiten Domagoj Duvnjak. Sve funkcioniše kao sat u igri Kila koji je bliži pobedi u Manhajmu.

BUNDESLIGA – 12. KOLO


Četvrtak


19.00: (1,70) Balingen (8,00) Štutgart  (2,55) 19.00: (1,50) Bergišer (8,50) Erlangen(3,15) 19.00: (2,55) Rajn Nekar Leven (8,00) Kil (1,70)

text:
Kil is chasing and 12th consecutive win
Baltic zebras are in great shape and favorites in Mannheim against weak Rhine Neckar Leven this season in the 12th round of the Bundesliga Handball

07 Nov 2019

Prior to the start of the season, Kil and Rhine Nekar Leuven, along with champion Flensburg, were given the highest chance of a Bundesliga handball title. The Baltic zebras justified it, with only one defeat, while the Lions are a disappointment in the first leg of the championship in Germany.
Both teams are in a different mood and form to receive the 12th round derby match on Thursday (7pm) in Mannheim. Three years later, Uwe Gensheimer, the greatest star of German handball in the last decade, returned to the riches of Pari-Saint-Germain in Rhine-Neckar Leuven. One of the best wings today plays great, effective, with 85 goals being the team's first scorer, but no help from teammates.
Swedish coach Christian Anderson, who has replaced trophy Danish Nikolai Jakobsen this season, has not yet found the right formula. The team is playing poorly and already has three defeats and five points less than the Hanover leaders. The attack continues to be pulled by the then Swiss Andi Schmidt. "Kil is extraordinary, and we are not. We have to say it is not five to 12 but it is 12 o'clock. We can beat Kil, but if we play at the highest level, "the midfielder told the German media.


ALL QUOTES FOR BUNDESLIG WINNERS





The host will have a lot of support for the sold-out halls in Mannheim, but guests have the role of favorites. The Lions did not win the Bundesliga in three rounds. After two tied draws last week they were defeated in Berlin by Fuhse.
Kil, on the other hand, is fantastic. Led by the debut on the bench of Philip Jih, the Zebra treads. They have 11 consecutive wins in the Bundesliga and Champions League. The only failure was experienced at the start of the season in Magdeburg. Vespers and Vardar were defeated in the Euro elite and the team from the Baltic confirmed that he was returning to the paths of old glory when he was dominant in Germany and was European champion three times.
Norwegian Harald Reinkind and Austrian Nikola Bilik are brilliant in the attack, with great Niklas Landin Jakobsen on goal, while captain Domagoj Duvnjak is the leader in defense. It all works like a clock in the game of Kilo closer to winning Mannheim.
